result.execSummary:
The defendant Pernell J WASHINGTON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The restitution issue to be held open for 60 days to allow the victim time to calculate her expenses.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with the victim or any place she temporarily occupies.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

The Court orders that Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  The balance remaining at release from prison to be paid as a condition of extended supervision at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with all other sentences imposed on this case.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
On count 1, 2nd degree sexual assault/use of force -  
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of thirty (30) years.  That is fifteen (15) years initial confinement followed by fifteen (15) years extended supervision.
On count 4, burglary - 
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of eight (8) years.  That is three (3) years initial confinement followed by five (5) years extended supervision, consecutive to count 1.
On count 5, strangulation and suffocation - 
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of four (4) years.  That is one (1) year initial confinement followed by three (3) years extended supervision, consecutive to counts 1 and 4.
On count 7, false imprisonment - 
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of four (4) years.  That is one (1) year initial confinement followed by three (3) years extended supervision, consecutive to counts 1, 4 and 5.
On count 9, battery -  
The defendant is sentenced to nine (9) months incarceration, concurrent with all other sentences imposed.
The Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
The defendant has credit for 181 days.  (07-20-14 until today)
Conditions of extended supervision:
1) Pay restitution  TBD.  The restitution issue to be held open for 60 days to allow the victim time to calculate her expenses;
2)\ Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;
3) No contact with the victim or any place she temporarily occupies;
4) Comply with Sex Offender Registry;
5) Maintain absolute sobriety;
6) Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge;
7) Pay court costs;
8) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
9) maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination.
The Court orders that Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  The balance remaining at release from prison to be paid as a condition of extended supervision at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Court costs on count 9 are waived by the court.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.
(ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)
